bibl.title: An Unusual Foundation Deposit at Kom Ombo.
bibl.note: At Kom Ombo, the remains of 12 columns are generally refered to as a "church". Copper coins of the IVth-Vth century were arranged on the tops of the column bases before the columns were put in position. Comparison with the discovery of coins in other buildings of late Roman and Byzantine date.

bibl.title: Bulletin de la Société d'Archéologie copte

bibl.seg: JONES Michael, An Unusual Foundation Deposit at Kom Ombo.
Bulletin de la Société d'Archéologie copte 31 (1992) pp. 97-107, 1 fig. et pll. X-XI.

At Kom Ombo, the remains of 12 columns are generally refered to as a "church". Copper coins of the IVth-Vth century were arranged on the tops of the column bases before the columns were put in position. Comparison with the discovery of coins in other buildings of late Roman and Byzantine date.
